comments.body: closing in favor of #174

OK, I won't notify you again about this release, but will get in touch when a new version is available. If you'd rather skip all updates until the next major or minor version, let me know by commenting `@dependabot ignore this major version` or `@dependabot ignore this minor version`.

If you change your mind, just re-open this PR and I'll resolve any conflicts on it.

comments.body:
We met on 1/31/2024 to look at the question how to handle the css required for user menu contained in the header.

We discussed the following options:

```
1. Fully re-write the application in bootstrap
2. Fully use a custom approach with Ryan's work as the foundation
3. Import just the part of bootstrap that we need
4. Use lux
```

For the purposes of our MVP we decided to stick with option 2 since the work is close to being complete for standard screens. We will create a second ticket to look at the menu's behavior on small screens and possibly pursue one of the other approaches at that time.

dspace-development.title: Change DataSpace banner to include more information of disabled submissions

comments.body: @astrochun I'm thinking we could adjust the message to direct PPPL users toward PDC as appropriate, while signaling to others that they should keep using DataSpace for now. Do you have a website up already that guides PPPL folks on using PDC? If so, I'd suggest linking to that. If not, we can just clarify the message in the banner.

> @astrochun I'm thinking we could adjust the message to direct PPPL users toward PDC as appropriate, while signaling to others that they should keep using DataSpace for now. Do you have a website up already that guides PPPL folks on using PDC? If so, I'd suggest linking to that. If not, we can just clarify the message in the banner.

Not immediately. We're doing a full refresh of our website and then would tackle the need to update pages for PDC information. An option that we can consider is to modify the banner to tell PPPL researchers to reach out to us at publications@pppl.gov

figgy.title: Paper Prototype attaching a Transcript to a Video

comments.body:
> How do we prevent people from marking "does not have transcribable audio" when it has transcribable audio? Can we verify with reasonable confidence? Are there any consequences for doing that?

As long as they have to make the decision I think we can go by trust.

## Resource Show Page:
Notes: 

- Visibility will always be "Private" on a Resource if any FileSets contain video and the user has not yet indicated that a video does not have any audio that can be captioned (silent, only background music, etc.) or that the video has audio that can be captioned but a VTT file has not been uploaded yet in its original language (aka, "Visibility Criteria"). A warning/notice of this constraint should diplay to the user next to any visibility indicator. 
- Question: Do we set a default for "Has audio that can be captioned?" or is there a null value, meaning the user has not made any indication?

![resource-show](https://github.com/pulibrary/figgy/assets/609368/095ce00d-3a08-404e-9d6e-564929bf62af)

## File Manager:
Notes:

- Any video FileSets that do not meet the "Visibility Criteria" should show a warning to the user. The warning should provide a link to the screen where one can add captions (or whatever file is required) for that FileSet.  

![filemanager](https://github.com/pulibrary/figgy/assets/609368/c7e3ebaf-7826-4f5d-a198-f1ee5c171791)

## FileSet Show Page:
Notes:

- Supplemental files (FileMetadata?) may be uploaded to the list of files. 
- If a file is deleted from this screen that affects the visibility of the resource (i.e. Captions in the original language), the user should be warned and confirm before deleting. 

![fileset-show](https://github.com/pulibrary/figgy/assets/609368/c2fde580-a81d-408a-ad98-638ac5408b96)

## FileSet Edit Page:
Notes:

- The only addition here is the "Has transcribable audio?" This indicates that there is no default and the user MUST make a selection before the resource can become visible. 
- If we require "Captions" (not just transcriptions) then we will need to change this language. Again, a "what's this" reveal would be helpful here. 
- If changing the value of that field will change the visibility of the resource, this should be indicated to the user before they click "Save".

![fileset-edit](https://github.com/pulibrary/figgy/assets/609368/32ecfbf2-51d9-46f2-b8a5-eb1cb6a614cb)

## Suplemental File Create/Upload Page:
Notes: 

- We will need to add these four options: Transcript, Subtitles, Closed Caption, Audio Description ([See WCAG](https://www.w3.org/WAI/media/av/planning/#none))
- Each type can have many language files, but each can have only one file for any given language. 
- If the user selects a type and language combination that already has a file associated with it, notify the user that a file exists and will be overwritten by the new file.
- There should be a "what's this?" reveal for users to ensure they understand the differences between types such as Transcripts, Captions, Subtitles, and Audio Descriptions

![create-supplemental](https://github.com/pulibrary/figgy/assets/609368/5f330625-8fa4-406f-8048-2c0de0f9c79a)

Note: Annotations of above images with descriptions of UI changes are in progress!

princeton_ansible.title: Failing/unreachable inventory hosts in staging group on Tower

comments.body:
With the most recent changes to the repo, and nothing in my `.ssh/config` file relating to using the bastion hosts, Ansible can now connect to GCP hosts from my laptop. The playbook fails, but I don't get `unreachable` any more:
```
% ansible-playbook playbooks/os_updates.yml --limit dspace_staging

PLAY [update the Operating System packages] *****************************************************************************************************

TASK [Gathering Facts] **************************************************************************************************************************
ok: [gcp_oar_staging1]
ok: [gcp_dataspace_staging1]

TASK [Ubuntu | refresh keys] ********************************************************************************************************************
changed: [gcp_oar_staging1]
changed: [gcp_dataspace_staging1]

TASK [Ubuntu | Upgrade all packages] ************************************************************************************************************
fatal: [gcp_dataspace_staging1]: FAILED! => {"changed": false, "msg": "Failed to update apt cache: unknown reason"}
fatal: [gcp_oar_staging1]: FAILED! => {"changed": false, "msg": "Failed to update apt cache: unknown reason"}

PLAY RECAP **************************************************************************************************************************************
gcp_dataspace_staging1     : ok=2    changed=1    unreachable=0    failed=1    skipped=0    rescued=0    ignored=0   
gcp_oar_staging1           : ok=2    changed=1    unreachable=0    failed=1    skipped=0    rescued=0    ignored=0
```
However, from Tower those same hosts still report `UNREACHABLE` - see https://ansible-tower.princeton.edu/#/jobs/playbook/98/output.

tiger-data-app.title: Query and display file count on project contents page

comments.body:
The aTerm command to retrieve the count of all files and directory in the collection and its subcollections is:

```
asset.count :where asset in static collection or subcollection of 1098
```

(where 1098 is the Mediaflux asset id)
